p: Other reports obtained potent nasal mucosal and systemic immune responses using intranasal delivery of whole, inactivated influenza vaccine powder formulations. Powder-formulated vaccine elicited a significant serum antibody response in rats that was at least as strong as the response from liquid vaccine administered by intranasal route or by intramuscular injection. 33, 34 In these reports, a mouse model was used to assess vaccine efficacy mediated by nanoparticle delivery by intranasal delivery, against influenza virus, parainfluenza, hepatitis B, and Streptococcus pneumoniae pathogens.
